content.description: Start around the right-hand corner of the boulder, climb up to the top, then traverse to the left side of the boulder using the lip.

Low start on positive edge, up to jugs.

Standing start is V0.

Also see the

Entry Way Boulder overview photo.
content.location: Right arete of the Entry Way Boulder.

content.description:
Path of least resistance up the center of the face of the Entry Way Boulder. Start on two positive crimps, up to a huge edge, then the top.

Also see the

Entry Way Boulder overview photo.
content.location: Center of the Entry Way Boulder.

content.description:
Sit-start on the big low hueco on the left side of the Entry Way Boulder. Stand up to the jug (crux) and top out right away or traverse the top to the right and finish on

Johnny Rocco

(preferred).

With the traverse finish, it's kind of a mirror image of

Why Can't Ya Let 'Em Live?

with a harder first move.

See the

left side of Entry Way Boulder photo

for a look at the problem. As good as the published problems on this boulder...add it to the rotation!
content.location: Left side of the Entry Way Boulder, to the left of Johnny Rocco.

content.description:
Path of least resistance up the left arete of the Entry Way Boulder using the holds on the back (i.e. left) rail.

Sit start is V2.

Also see the

Entry Way Boulder overview photo

and the

Johnny Rocco/Crossfire beta photo.
content.location: Left side of the Entry Way Boulder.

content.description: Begin on a good right-hand sidepull and head straight up.
content.location: On the Entry Way boulder right on the main trail.

content.description: Start with left hand way low on a sharp quarter pad crimp, and right hand on the edge where you normally heel hook for the OG start. This variation adds two hard moves which place you at the start holds for the original problem. Excellent and an extremely satisfying first move.
content.location: Lowest start to the Overhang at Entryway.

content.description:
Sit start under overhang on jugs...right hand on arete. Slap up for a move or two then mantel. Excellent rock and enjoyable moves.Variation: Sit-start matched on the horn-type jug(broke/gone) and go up to the left. Also about V2 and quite fun. Everything except the start hold is just out of the second photo that's posted here.More variations possible.Feel free to comment actual name/rating info...I just made this stuff up for a well-traveled problem that isn't in the books.Also see the

Entry Way Boulder overview photo

.
content.location: Left of Johnny Rocco in a low overhang behind the Entry Way Boulder face climbs.

content.description: Climb the arete on the left side of the entry way boulder without using the back wall.  V0ish if you use the back wall.
content.location: Left arete of the entry way boulder.
